description.para: The following enumeration type indicates where a point is located in the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: the located point coincides with a vertex of the triangulation
the point is in the relative interior of an edge
the point is in the interior of a facet

description.para: The following types represent geometric objects.

briefdescription.para: Represents a point in the hyperbolic plane.

detaileddescription.para: Note that for Delaunay triangulations of the Bolza surface, all points must lie inside the original hyperbolic octagon.

briefdescription.para: Represents a hyperbolic segment in the hyperbolic plane.
Represents a triangle contained in the Poincar√© disk.

description.para: The following type represents hyperbolic translations specific for the Bolza surface.
The following types represent images of points, segments, and triangles under the action of hyperbolic translations.

briefdescription.para: Represents a periodic point, i.e., a pair of a point in the original octagon and a hyperbolic translation.

memberdef.definition: typedef std::array< std::pair<Point, Hyperbolic_translation>, 2 > CGAL::Periodic_4_hyperbolic_triangulation_2< GT, TDS >::Periodic_segment
memberdef.name: Periodic_segment

briefdescription.para: Represents a periodic segment, defined by two periodic points.

memberdef.definition: typedef std::array< std::pair<Point, Hyperbolic_translation>, 3 > CGAL::Periodic_4_hyperbolic_triangulation_2< GT, TDS >::Periodic_triangle
memberdef.name: Periodic_triangle

briefdescription.para: Represents a periodic triangle, defined by three periodic points.

description.para: The following types give access to the elements of the triangulation.
The following iterator and circulator types are defined to give access over the vertices, edges, and faces of the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor, with an optional parameter for the geometric traits object.
Copy constructor.
The triangulation tr is duplicated, and modifying the copy after the duplication does not modify the original.
The triangulation is swapped with tr.
Deletes all faces and vertices of the triangulation.
Returns a const reference to the geometric traits object.
Returns a const reference to the triangulation data structure.
Returns a reference to the triangulation data structure.
Returns the number of vertices in the triangulation.
Returns the number of edges in the triangulation.
Returns the number of faces in the triangulation.

description.para: The functions below return periodic points, segments, and triangles.

briefdescription.para: Returns the periodic point given by the i-th vertex of face f, that is the point in the original domain and the translation of the vertex in f.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p1, const Point &p2, const Hyperbolic_translation &tr1, const Hyperbolic_translation &tr2) const
memberdef.name: periodic_segment

briefdescription.para: Returns the periodic segment formed by the two point-translation pairs (p1, tr1) and (p2, tr2).
Returns the periodic segment formed by the two point-translation pairs (p1, Id) and (p2, Id), where Id is the identity translation.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Face_handle c, int i, int j) const
memberdef.name: periodic_segment

briefdescription.para: Returns the periodic segment formed by the endpoints of edge (f,i,j).
Returns the periodic segment formed by the endpoints of edge e.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the translations in the resulting periodic segment are determined by e.first.

briefdescription.para: Returns the periodic segment formed by the endpoints of edge e translated by tr.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the translations in the resulting segment are determined by the translations in e.first, multiplied on the left by tr.

briefdescription.para: Returns the periodic triangle formed by the pairs of points and translations corresponding to each vertex of f.
Returns the periodic triangle formed by the pairs of points and translations corresponding to each vertex of f, translated by tr.

description.para: The functions below return non-periodic points, segments and triangles.

briefdescription.para: Converts the periodic point pp into a point in the hyperbolic plane by applying pp.second to pp.first.
Constructs the hyperbolic segment formed by the endpoints of edge (fh, idx).
Returns the hyperbolic segment with endpoints p1 and p2.
Returns the hyperbolic segment formed by the endpoints of e.
Returns the hyperbolic segment formed by the endpoints of ps.
Returns the triangle formed by the vertices of fh.
Returns the triangle formed by the vertices of pt.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p, Hyperbolic_translation &lo, const Face_handle start=Face_handle()) const
memberdef.name: hyperbolic_periodic_locate

briefdescription.para: Returns the face rf for which the periodic triangle (rf, lo) contains the query point p.

detaileddescription.para: The parameter start, if provided, is used as a starting point for the location.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p, Locate_type &lt, int &li, Hyperbolic_translation &lo, const Face_handle start=Face_handle()) const
memberdef.name: hyperbolic_periodic_locate

briefdescription.para: Same as above.

detaileddescription.para: The value of the variable lt indicates whether p has been located inside the hyperbolic triangle, on one of its sides, or on one of its vertices. If p is located on a side or on a vertex, then li contains the index of the corresponding edge or vertex in the returned face. The parameter start, if provided, is used as a starting point for the location.

briefdescription.para: Returns the canonical representative of the face that contains the query point p.

detaileddescription.para: The parameter start, if provided, is used as a starting point for the location.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p, Locate_type &lt, int &li, Face_handle start=Face_handle()) const
memberdef.name: hyperbolic_locate

briefdescription.para: Same as above.

detaileddescription.para: The value of the variable lt indicates whether p has been located inside the canonical representative, on one of its sides, or on one of its vertices. If p is located on a side or on a vertex, then li contains the index of the corresponding edge or vertex in the returned face. The parameter start, if provided, is used as a starting point for the location.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p1, const Point &p2, const Point &p3) const
memberdef.name: orientation

briefdescription.para: Returns the Orientation of the points p1, p2, p3.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p1, const Point &p2, const Point &p3, const Hyperbolic_translation &tr1, const Hyperbolic_translation &tr2, const Hyperbolic_translation &tr3) const
memberdef.name: orientation

briefdescription.para: Returns the Orientation of the three periodic points (p1, tr1), (p2, tr2) and (p3, tr3).

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p1, const Point &p2, const Point &p3, const Point &q) const
memberdef.name: side_of_oriented_circle

briefdescription.para: Returns the Oriented_side on which q is located with respect to the circle defined by the points p1,p2,p3.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p1, const Point &p2, const Point &p3, const Point &q, const Hyperbolic_translation &tr1, const Hyperbolic_translation &tr2, const Hyperbolic_translation &tr3, const Hyperbolic_translation &trq) const
memberdef.name: side_of_oriented_circle

briefdescription.para: Returns the Oriented_side on which the periodic point (q, trq) is located with respect to the circle defined by the periodic points (p1, tr1), (p2, tr2) and (p3, tr3).
Tests whether v is a vertex of the triangulation.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vertex_handle u, Vertex_handle v, Face_handle &fh, int &i) const
memberdef.name: is_edge

briefdescription.para: Tests whether (u, v) is an edge of the triangulation.

detaileddescription.para: If the edge is found, then it is the i-th edge of fh.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vertex_handle u, Vertex_handle v, Vertex_handle w, Face_handle &fh) const
memberdef.name: is_face

briefdescription.para: Tests whether there exists a face in the triangulation with vertices u, v and w.

detaileddescription.para: If the face is found, then it is returned as fh.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Face_handle f, const Vertex_handle v, const int i) const
memberdef.name: has_vertex

briefdescription.para: Tests whether face f has v as a vertex.

detaileddescription.para: If the answer is true, then i contains the index of v in f.

briefdescription.para: Starts at an arbitrary vertex.

detaileddescription.para: Iterates over all the vertices in the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: Past-the-end iterator.
Starts at an arbitrary edge.

detaileddescription.para: Iterates over all the edges in the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: Past-the-end iterator.
Starts at an arbitrary face.

detaileddescription.para: Iterates over all the faces of the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: Past-the-end iterator.
Starts at an arbitrary vertex incident to v.
Starts at the first vertex of f adjacent to v in counterclockwise order around v.
Starts at an arbitrary edge incident to v.
Starts at the first edge of f incident to v, in counterclockwise order around v.
Starts at an arbitrary face incident to v.
Starts at face f.

sectiondef.header: Traversal of the Vertices, Edges and Faces incident to a vertex

briefdescription.para: Copies the faces incident to v into the output iterator faces.
Copies the edges incident to v into the output iterator edges.
Copies the vertices incident to v into the output iterator vertices.
Returns the degree of v, i.e., the number of edges incident to v.
Returns the index of f in its i-th neighbor.
Returns the vertex of the i-th neighbor of f that is opposite to f.
Returns the same edge seen from the other adjacent face.
Returns the hyperbolic translation for which the i-th neighbor of fh is adjacent to (the canonical representative of) fh in the hyperbolic plane.
Checks the combinatorial validity of the triangulation, and also the validity of its geometric embedding.
Checks the combinatorial validity of face f.
The class Periodic_4_hyperbolic_triangulation_2 offers base functionalities needed by Periodic_4_hyperbolic_Delaunay_triangulation_2.

detaileddescription.para: Note that this class does not support modification of the triangulation (insertion or removal).
The class expects two template parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Geometric traits parameter. Must be a model of the concept Periodic_4HyperbolicTriangulationTraits_2. This parameter has no default value.

Triangulation data structure parameter. Must be a model of the concept TriangulationDataStructure_2 with some additional functionality in the vertices and faces, following the concepts Periodic_4HyperbolicTriangulationVertexBase_2 and Periodic_4HyperbolicTriangulationFaceBase_2, respectively. The default value for this parameter is CGAL::Triangulation_data_structure_2< CGAL::Periodic_4_hyperbolic_triangulation_vertex_base_2<GT>, CGAL::Periodic_4_hyperbolic_triangulation_face_base_2<GT>>
